meanings.definition: To remove or reduce sexual characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The artist desexualized the painting by covering up the revealing parts.
meanings.sent2: The school's dress code policy aims to desexualize the students' attire.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the magician desexualized the show by making the rabbits disappear.
meanings.sent4: The new regulations desexualized the workplace environment, making it more professional.
meanings.sent5: The movie director decided to desexualize the scene to make it suitable for all audiences.

meanings.definition: To make something less sexual in nature.
meanings.sent1: The company's marketing team worked to desexualize the advertisement campaign.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped the patient desexualize their thoughts and focus on other aspects of life.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was said to desexualize the spicy dish, making it more family-friendly.
meanings.sent4: The new policy aimed to desexualize relationships in the workplace to maintain professionalism.
meanings.sent5: The counselor's advice was to desexualize the conversation and keep it platonic.
